title: FTSE LIVE: Metro Bank chairman quits; Pound flat after MPs reject Brexit timetable
text:
Troubled lender Metro Bank has said that its founder and chairman Vernon Hill has resigned with immediate effect. The group said in July that Hill would step down, but the plan was for his to stay on as president and a non-executive director.

Meanwhile, the competition watchdog has slapped three building firms with more than £36million in fines for taking part in an illegal price-fixing cartel.

The pound is treading water at around $1.286 in early trading on Wednesday as another day dawns in Brexit Purgatory.

Prime Minister Boris Johnson's three day timetable to ratify his withdrawal agreement failed to wash with MPs, so the currency (and the country) is waiting to see now if the deal can be ratified with a short extension, or if UK will go to the polls with a General Election.
